sentences: Minuga võtaksid ühenduse, kui teil oleks vaja.
Töökaaslastega kontakti otsides võiks teiega minuga rääkida.
Kõigepealt tuleb mulle minuga ise kokku saada.
context: The word 'minuga' is the comitative case form of the Estonian pronoun 'mina', which means 'me'. In English, it translates to 'with me' or 'along with me'. The comitative case in Estonian indicates accompaniment - being together with someone or something. It's used when you want to express that an action is done along with the speaker or includes them as a participant.
